meanings.definition: Relating to the measurement of refractive indices.
meanings.sent1: The refractometric test helped us understand how light bends in different materials.
meanings.sent2: Scientists use refractometric tools to study how light changes direction in various substances.
meanings.sent3: The refractometric experiment turned into a fun game of guessing the refractive index of liquids.
meanings.sent4: Her mind worked like a refractometric prism, breaking down complex ideas into simpler components.
meanings.sent5: The refractometric concept shone brightly in her mind, illuminating the world of optics.

meanings.definition: Using refractometry to determine the refractive index of a substance.
meanings.sent1: The refractometric revealed the refractive index of the unknown liquid accurately.
meanings.sent2: A scientist's job involves performing refractometric tests to identify the refractive index of materials.
meanings.sent3: The refractometric at the lab accidentally measured the refractive index of a sandwich instead of a liquid.
meanings.sent4: His eyes acted like a refractometric device, analyzing the world through a unique lens.
meanings.sent5: The refractometric instrument hummed softly as it unveiled the secrets of light bending in the substance.
